title: Function reference
text:
Introduction to the package.



Functions to inspect docstrings.



aj

title: Get started with polarstate
text:
import polars as pl
from polarstate.aj import aalen_johansen

Get starteds with polarstate

times = pl.Series([1, 2, 3, 4, 5])
reals = pl.Series([1, 0, 2, 1, 0])

result = aalen_johansen(times, reals)

print(result)

shape: (3, 2)
┌──────┬────────┐
│ time ┆ cuminc │
│ ---  ┆ ---    │
│ i64  ┆ f64    │
╞══════╪════════╡
│ 1    ┆ 0.2    │
│ 3    ┆ 0.2    │
│ 4    ┆ 0.7    │
└──────┴────────┘

title: aj
text:
aj





Name
Description




aalen_johansen
Compute the Aalen-Johansen estimator for cumulative incidence in the presence of competing risks.





aj.aalen_johansen(times, reals, event_of_interest=1, competing_events=None)
Compute the Aalen-Johansen estimator for cumulative incidence in the presence of competing risks.











Name
Type
Description
Default




times
pl.Series
Event or censoring times for each observation.
required


reals
pl.Series
Event type for each observation (0 for censored, event codes otherwise).
required


event_of_interest
int
The event code for the event of interest (default is 1).
1


competing_events
list of int
List of event codes considered as competing events. If None, defaults to [2].
None














Name
Type
Description





pl.DataFrame
DataFrame with columns: - ‘time’: unique event times - ‘cuminc’: cumulative incidence estimate at each time






This implementation assumes that event codes are integers, with 0 indicating censoring.
